resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
shiro615 commented on pull request #4658: ARROW-5535: [GLib] Add garrow_table_slice()
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4658
 
 
   `Arrow::Table#slice` has already been implemented in Red Arrow. So this PR replaces current `#slice` with `#slice` implemented by GLib.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

shiro615 commented on pull request #4658: ARROW-5535: [GLib] Add garrow_table_slice()
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4658#discussion_r296450362
 
 

 ##########
 File path: ruby/red-arrow/lib/arrow/table.rb
 ##########
 @@ -197,10 +197,38 @@ def each_record_batch
     alias_method :length, :n_rows
 
     alias_method :[], :find_column
+    alias_method :slice_raw, :slice
 
-    # TODO
+    # @overload slice(offset, length)
     #
-    # @return [Arrow::Table]
+    #   @param offset [Integer] The offset of sub Arrow::Table.
+    #   @param length [Integer] The length of sub Arrow::Table.
+    #   @return [Arrow::Table]
+    #     The sub Arrow::Table. It covers only from
+    #     `offset` to `offset + length` range.
+    #
+    # @overload slice(offset)
+    #
+    #   @param offset [Integer] The offset of sub Arrow::Table.
+    #   @return [Arrow::Table]
+    #      The sub Arrow::Table. It covers only from
+    #      `offset` until end of the table.
 
 Review comment:
   @kou This breaks backward compatibility. But I've changed it because I think it better to match the C++ API.
   How do you think about this?  Is there anything we need to do to Red Arrow users to make this change?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

kou commented on pull request #4658: ARROW-5535: [GLib] Add garrow_table_slice()
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4658#discussion_r296457744
 
 

 ##########
 File path: ruby/red-arrow/lib/arrow/table.rb
 ##########
 @@ -197,10 +197,52 @@ def each_record_batch
     alias_method :length, :n_rows
 
     alias_method :[], :find_column
+    alias_method :slice_raw, :slice
 
-    # TODO
+    # @overload slice(offset, length)
     #
-    # @return [Arrow::Table]
+    #   @param offset [Integer] The offset of sub Arrow::Table.
+    #   @param length [Integer] The length of sub Arrow::Table.
+    #   @return [Arrow::Table]
+    #     The sub `Arrow::Table`. It covers only from
+    #     `offset` to `offset + length` range.
+    #
+    # @overload slice(offset)
+    #
+    #   @param offset [Integer] The offset of sub Arrow::Table.
+    #   @return [Arrow::Table]
+    #      The sub `Arrow::Table`. It covers only from
+    #      `offset` until end of the table.
+    #
+    # @overload slice(boolean_array)
+    #
+    #   @param boolean_array [Array<Boolean>] The values indicating the target rows.
+    #   @return [Arrow::Table]
+    #      The sub `Arrow::Table`. It covers only rows of index
+    #      the values of `boolean_array` is true.
+    #
+    # @overload slice(arrow_boolean_array)
 
 Review comment:
   How about `boolean_array`?

kou commented on pull request #4658: ARROW-5535: [GLib] Add garrow_table_slice()
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4658#discussion_r296457391
 
 

 ##########
 File path: ruby/red-arrow/lib/arrow/table.rb
 ##########
 @@ -197,10 +197,38 @@ def each_record_batch
     alias_method :length, :n_rows
 
     alias_method :[], :find_column
+    alias_method :slice_raw, :slice
 
-    # TODO
+    # @overload slice(offset, length)
     #
-    # @return [Arrow::Table]
+    #   @param offset [Integer] The offset of sub Arrow::Table.
+    #   @param length [Integer] The length of sub Arrow::Table.
+    #   @return [Arrow::Table]
+    #     The sub Arrow::Table. It covers only from
+    #     `offset` to `offset + length` range.
+    #
+    # @overload slice(offset)
+    #
+    #   @param offset [Integer] The offset of sub Arrow::Table.
+    #   @return [Arrow::Table]
+    #      The sub Arrow::Table. It covers only from
+    #      `offset` until end of the table.
 
 Review comment:
   This is expected to be the same interface as Ruby's `Array#slice(index)`: https://docs.ruby-lang.org/en/2.6.0/Array.html#method-i-slice
   
   But the current implementation doesn't match the interface... We should return `Arrow::Record` or `nil` for `slice(index)`.
   
   The current API accepts argument and block mix: `table.slice(1) {...}`. But we should stop this feature to implement `slice(index) -> Record|nil`. It breaks backward compatibility but is acceptable.
   
   ```ruby
   if block_given?
     unless args.empty?
       raise ArgumentError, ...
     end
     block_slicer = yield(...)
     ...
   else
     case args.size
     ...
     end
   end
   ```
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

     alias_method :[], :find_column
+    alias_method :slice_raw, :slice
 
 Review comment:
   Could you put a new line between `alias_method :[]` and `alias_method :slice_raw`?
   Because they aren't related.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the

users@infra.apache.org

kou commented on pull request #4658: ARROW-5535: [GLib] Add garrow_table_slice()
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4658#discussion_r296457680
 
 

 ##########
 File path: ruby/red-arrow/lib/arrow/table.rb
 ##########
 @@ -197,10 +197,52 @@ def each_record_batch
     alias_method :length, :n_rows
 
     alias_method :[], :find_column
+    alias_method :slice_raw, :slice
 
-    # TODO
+    # @overload slice(offset, length)
     #
-    # @return [Arrow::Table]
+    #   @param offset [Integer] The offset of sub Arrow::Table.
+    #   @param length [Integer] The length of sub Arrow::Table.
+    #   @return [Arrow::Table]
+    #     The sub `Arrow::Table`. It covers only from
+    #     `offset` to `offset + length` range.
+    #
+    # @overload slice(offset)
+    #
+    #   @param offset [Integer] The offset of sub Arrow::Table.
+    #   @return [Arrow::Table]
+    #      The sub `Arrow::Table`. It covers only from
+    #      `offset` until end of the table.
+    #
+    # @overload slice(boolean_array)
+    #
+    #   @param boolean_array [Array<Boolean>] The values indicating the target rows.
+    #   @return [Arrow::Table]
+    #      The sub `Arrow::Table`. It covers only rows of index
+    #      the values of `boolean_array` is true.
+    #
+    # @overload slice(arrow_boolean_array)
+    #
+    #   @param arrow_boolean_array [::Array<Arrow::BooleanArray>] The values indicating the target rows.
+    #   @return [Arrow::Table]
+    #      The sub `Arrow::Table`. It covers only rows of index
+    #      the values of `arrow_boolean_array` is true.
+    #
+    # @overload slice(range_included_end)
+    #
+    #   @param range_included_end [Range] The range indicating the target rows.
+    #   @return [Arrow::Table]
+    #     The sub `Arrow::Table`. It covers only rows of the range
+    #     included end.
+    #
+    # @overload slice(range_excluded_end)
+    #
+    #   @param range_excluded_end [Range] The range indicating the target rows.
+    #   @return [Arrow::Table]
+    #     The sub `Arrow::Table`. It covers only rows of the range
+    #     excluded end.
 
 Review comment:
   Could you combine to one `@overload`: `@overload slice(range)`?
   We don't need to split them.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

kou commented on pull request #4658: ARROW-5535: [GLib] Add garrow_table_slice()
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4658#discussion_r296457566
 
 

 ##########
 File path: ruby/red-arrow/lib/arrow/table.rb
 ##########
 @@ -457,47 +499,16 @@ def boolean_array_to_slice_ranges(array, offset, ranges)
       end
     end
 
-    # TODO: Almost codes should be implemented in Apache Arrow C++.
     def slice_by_ranges(ranges)
-      sliced_columns = columns.collect do |column|
-        chunks = []
-        arrays = column.data.each_chunk.to_a
-        offset = 0
-        offset_in_array = 0
-        ranges.each do |from, to|
-          range_size = to - from + 1
-          while range_size > 0
-            while offset + arrays.first.length - offset_in_array < from
-              offset += arrays.first.length - offset_in_array
-              arrays.shift
-              offset_in_array = 0
-            end
-            if offset < from
-              skipped_size = from - offset
-              offset += skipped_size
-              offset_in_array += skipped_size
-            end
-            array = arrays.first
-            array_length = array.length
-            rest_length = array_length - offset_in_array
-            if rest_length <= range_size
-              chunks << array.slice(offset_in_array, array_length)
-              offset += rest_length
-              range_size -= rest_length
-              offset_in_array = 0
-              arrays.shift
-            else
-              chunks << array.slice(offset_in_array, range_size)
-              offset += range_size
-              offset_in_array += range_size
-              range_size = 0
-            end
-          end
-        end
-        Column.new(column.field, ChunkedArray.new(chunks))
+      sliced_table = []
+      ranges.each do |from, to|
+        sliced_table << slice_raw(from, to - from + 1)
 
 Review comment:
   Should we validate `from` and the length? For example, is `-3` for `from` valid in C++? Is `from=3` and `to=-2` pair valid in C++?
   
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

users@infra.apache.org
